Question
========

Suppose there are two players playing with four pure dice. They must take turns rolling these four dice at the same time. Player *A* gets a point if no 3 is rolled and player *B* gets a point if at least one of the four dice has one 3 on top. Is this a fair game for both players according to probability theory?

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, because both players have the same probability.
* No, because player A has a greater chance than player B.
* No, because player B has a greater chance than player A.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Yes, because both players have the same odds: Incorrect
* No, because player A has a greater chance than player B.:Incorrect
* No, because player B has a greater chance than player A.: Correct
